newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-BHP sees no new 1997/98 write-downs.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-BHP sees no new 1997/98 write-downs.

text.p: The Broken Hill Pty Co Ltd managing director John Prescott said on Friday that although the company was still in transition, he did not expect any further abnormal items or write-downs in the current financial year to May 31, 1998.
"I wouldn't expect any further abnormal items or write-downs in this year," Prescott told a news confernce.
BHP earlier on Friday revealed it had recorded an abnormal loss before tax of A$1.046 billion and an abnormal loss after tax of A$976 million in the year to May 31, 1997.

It said the abnormal losses included a write-down in some North American copper assets of A$550 million, a writedown in steel assets of A$220 million and a writedown in minerals assets of A$189 million.
The abnormal losses cut BHP's net profit for the year to A$410 million, down 60.8 percent from the 1995/96 result of A$1.O46 billion.
